jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #5877: ARROW-6954: [Python] [CI] Add Python 3.8 to CI matrix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5877#discussion_r348965479
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/docker/conda-python.dockerfile
 ##########
 @@ -22,13 +22,15 @@ FROM ${org}/${arch}-conda-cpp:latest
 # install python specific packages
 ARG python=3.6
 COPY ci/conda_env_python.yml /arrow/ci/
-RUN conda install -q \
+RUN conda install -n testenv -q \
         --file arrow/ci/conda_env_python.yml \
         python=${python} \
-        tensorflow \
         nomkl && \
     conda clean --all
 
+COPY python/requirements.txt /arrow/python/
+RUN bash -c "source activate testenv && pip install -r /arrow/python/requirements.txt"
 
 Review comment:
   Why is this needed? 
   If there is something missing (six?), should that be added to `conda_env_python.yml` ?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #5877: ARROW-6954: [Python] [CI] Add Python 3.8 to CI matrix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5877#discussion_r348992609
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/docker/conda-python.dockerfile
 ##########
 @@ -22,13 +22,15 @@ FROM ${org}/${arch}-conda-cpp:latest
 # install python specific packages
 ARG python=3.6
 COPY ci/conda_env_python.yml /arrow/ci/
-RUN conda install -q \
+RUN conda install -n testenv -q \
         --file arrow/ci/conda_env_python.yml \
         python=${python} \
-        tensorflow \
         nomkl && \
     conda clean --all
 
+COPY python/requirements.txt /arrow/python/
+RUN bash -c "source activate testenv && pip install -r /arrow/python/requirements.txt"
 
 Review comment:
   It's needed for 2.7 backports such as [futures](https://pypi.org/project/futures/). They must only be installed on Python 2 builds, and I don't know how to express that in a conda YAML file.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #5877: ARROW-6954: [Python] [CI] Add Python 3.8 to CI matrix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5877#issuecomment-557661833
 
 
   * Flight: because it's not used by the R bindings
   * ORC: because there was a weird link error in that build and, since ORC is not relevant for testing HDFS, I decided to disable it instead of spending more time diagnosing the issue

kszucs commented on issue #5877: ARROW-6954: [Python] [CI] Add Python 3.8 to CI matrix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5877#issuecomment-557842434
 
 
   I'm not in favor of introducing a testenv Conda environment, it makes the scripts and the interactive debugging more complicated, like `docker-compose run conda-python bash` should open a shell with the base environment activated. With testenv we need to activate it manually. If we can change the default conda environment from base to testenv then it's fine from me.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #5877: ARROW-6954: [Python] [CI] Add Python 3.8 to CI matrix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5877#issuecomment-558112905
 
 
   > I'm not in favor of introducing a testenv Conda environment
   
   This is mandatory for this PR. Conda refuses to switch the base Python version to 3.8 (it produces conflicts). Also, separating the base environment (which contains the conda install) from work environments is recommended practice.
   
   >  If we can change the default conda environment from base to testenv then it's fine from me.
   
   I'm not sure how to do that. Even if we change the `bash` defaults, it won't affect commands executed without a shell.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
